name: Marranitos
description: A marranito is a Mexican pastry shaped like a piggy. It can be soft like a sweet bread or more on the hard side like a cookie.

itemListElement.text: Place water, piloncillo, cinnamon, clove, and star anise in a medium saucepot set to medium heat. Simmer slowly and stir until the piloncillo dissolves. Continue to simmer until the mixture has the consistency of natural maple syrup. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Strain. (For this recipe we will only be using 1/2 cup of the piloncillo syrup. You can save the rest to use later.)
itemListElement.name: Place water, piloncillo, cinnamon, clove, and star anise in a medium saucepot set to medium heat. Simmer slowly and stir until the piloncillo dissolves. Continue to simmer until the mixture has the consistency of natural maple syrup. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Strain. (For this recipe we will only be using 1/2 cup of the piloncillo syrup. You can save the rest to use later.)

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl, combine the whole wheat and all-purpose flours, baking powder, and baking soda.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl, combine the whole wheat and all-purpose flours, baking powder, and baking soda.

itemListElement.text: Combine 1/2 cup of the piloncillo syrup with the melted butter and mix well.
itemListElement.name: Combine 1/2 cup of the piloncillo syrup with the melted butter and mix well.

itemListElement.text: Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix with a wooden spoon until the dough begin to comes together.
itemListElement.name: Pour the wet ingredients into the bowl with the dry ingredients and mix with a wooden spoon until the dough begin to comes together.

itemListElement.text: Use your hands to incorporate the dough together and form a ball. The dough will be on the wet side. If the dough is too dry add a bit more of the piloncillo syrup.
itemListElement.name: Use your hands to incorporate the dough together and form a ball. The dough will be on the wet side. If the dough is too dry add a bit more of the piloncillo syrup.

itemListElement.text: Cover in plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 30 - 1 hour.
itemListElement.name: Cover in plastic wrap and place in the fridge for 30 - 1 hour.

itemListElement.text: Remove the dough from the fridge and roll out on a floured surface to 1/3 inch thickness.
itemListElement.name: Remove the dough from the fridge and roll out on a floured surface to 1/3 inch thickness.

itemListElement.text: Use a large pig-shaped cookie cutter to cut out the dough and place them on a parchment-lined sheet tray.
itemListElement.name: Use a large pig-shaped cookie cutter to cut out the dough and place them on a parchment-lined sheet tray.

itemListElement.text: Reform the dough scraps into a ball and roll out again to cut out more marranitos. Repeat this process until you cannot cut out any more.
itemListElement.name: Reform the dough scraps into a ball and roll out again to cut out more marranitos. Repeat this process until you cannot cut out any more.

itemListElement.text: Combine the plant milk and maple syrup in a small bowl to make your "egg wash". Brush marranitos with "egg wash".
itemListElement.name: Combine the plant milk and maple syrup in a small bowl to make your "egg wash". Brush marranitos with "egg wash".

itemListElement.text: Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the marranitos are golden brown on the bottom.
itemListElement.name: Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the marranitos are golden brown on the bottom.

itemListElement.text: Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
itemListElement.name: Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
